did.abstract: The Hershell Howard Nixon And Joan Lowery Nixon Papers, 1974-1978 is a collection of general correspondence, drafts, galley proofs, a book, and newspaper clippings from Joan Lowery Nixon's writing career and Hershell Howard Nixon's work as an exploration petroleum geologist and memberships in the American Association of Petroleum Geologists, the American Professional Geological Scientists, the Houston Geological Society, the West Texas Geological Society, and the Rocky Mountain Association of Geologists

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Hershell Howard Nixon was born near Duncan, Oklahoma on August 4, 1923. His family moved to California during the Dust Bowl and settled near Bakersfield. During World War II, Nixon served in the United States Navy, after the war, he attended the University of Southern California, from which he received a Bachelor of Science degree in 1950. Nixon worked as an exploration petroleum geologist and was a member of the American Association of Petroleum Geologists, the American Professional Geological Scientists, the Houston Geological Society, the West Texas Geological Society, and the Rocky Mountain Association of Geologists. In 1949, Nixon married Joan Lowery, and he supported her writing career in addition to co-authoring several children's books on science. The couple had four children. Nixon died on March 8, 2010.

Joan Lowery Nixon was born in Los Angeles, California on February 3, 1927. She wrote more than 140 books, including one, The Other Side of Dark, which was made into a film. Nixon won four Edgar Awards from the Mystery Writers of America and is the only person to do so. In addition, she won two Golden Spur awards from the Western Writers of America. Her books were published in 20 languages. Nixon died on June 28, 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: General correspondence, drafts, galley proofs, a book, and clippings from 1974 to 1978 from Joan Lowery Nixon's writing career and Hershell Howard Nixon's work as an exploration petroleum geologist.
